Create a HTLM Document

To load the JavaScript file and provide space for the Three.js canvas, we need to set up a basic HTML document with a <script> tag that links to the JavaScript file.

Creating the scene

Now we need to import Three.js into our JavaScript. After that, we have to create a scene. We need three things for this: a scene, a camera, and a renderer. For this project, I am using the PerspectiveCamera.

Creating the cube

To create a cube, we need a BoxGeometry, which defines the cube's shape in terms of the three mathematical axes: X-Axis, Y-Axis, and Z-Axis. Next, we add a material and set its color. Then we create a mesh, which combines the geometry with the material. Finally, we add the cube to the scene using scene.add().

Add rotation and start the render

Now we are ready to start rendering. To do this, we need a render or animation loop. To make it more interesting, we can rotate the cube. By adding cube.rotation.x += 0.01; and cube.rotation.y += 0.01;, we give it a smooth rotating animation.
